there.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: You use there are before a plural noun    You will sometimes hear native speakers say this is in informal conversation, but it is grammatically incorrect
There are a lot of problems
There is a lot of problems
there.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1: Instead of saying there is, you often say there’s
there.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: USAGE: Spelling
there.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0: Don’t confuse there and their You write  Don’t write
there.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: in or to a particular place that is not where you are
there.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: We could go back to my cottage and have lunch there.
Scotland? I’ve always wanted to go there.
Hold it right there and don’t move.
Can you pass me that wine glass there?
Look, there’s that bookshop I was telling you about.
It’s too far to drive there and back in one day.
Are we going to get there (=arrive) before the banks close?
I know there’s a mouse under there somewhere.
We flew to Miami and from there to La Paz.
there.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if something is there, it exists
there.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The chance was there, but I didn’t take it.
The countryside is there for everyone to enjoy.
Three months after the operation, the pain was still there.
there.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: at or to a particular point in time, in a process, or in a story
there.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Let’s stop there and I’ll tell you the rest of the story tomorrow.
She got a divorce, but her troubles didn’t end there.
There’s still a lot of work to do, but we’re getting there (=coming to the end of the process) slowly.
there.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: used to refer to something that someone has said when you are answering them
there.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: That’s true. I agree with you there.
‘Why did the system fail?’ ‘Well, there you’ve got me – I really don’t know.’
there.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: used when greeting someone or calling to them
there.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: Hi there, you must be Laura.
there.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: used when you want to speak to someone on the telephone and someone else answers
there.translation[1].definitions[5].exam: Hello, Georgie, is your mother there?
there.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: used to express satisfaction that you have been proved right or that you have done what you intended to do
there.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: There! I’ve done it! I’ve resigned.
There, what did I tell you? I knew it wouldn’t work.
